snippet: “Your schools are no good, you have no jobs, 58 percent of your youth is unemployed — what the hell do you have to lose?” Mr. Trump said of African-Americans at a rally....
abstract: Several black Americans discuss their views regarding Donald J Trump's latest effort to court their votes; some of those interviewed say his depiction of community as full of violence and dysfunction is major over-generalization, if not completely false; also note this is just another way Republican presidential candidate is appealing to white voters by reinforcing negative stereotypes.

byline.original: By RICHARD FAUSSET, ALAN BLINDER and JOHN ELIGON
byline.contributor: Richard Fausset and Alan Blinder reported from Atlanta, and John Eligon from Kansas City, Mo. Nick Corasaniti contributed reporting from Tampa, Fla., and Maggie Haberman from New York.

lead_paragraph: “Your schools are no good, you have no jobs, 58 percent of your youth is unemployed — what the hell do you have to lose?” Mr. Trump said of African-Americans at a rally.

headline.main: Donald Trump’s Description of Black America Is Offending Those Living in It
headline.print_headline: Blacks Beg to Differ With Trump’s Depiction
